intro: Draba colchaguensis, commonly known as the Andes mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are basal, rosette-like, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Draba colchaguensis is known for its resilience to harsh climates and is often found in mountainous areas of Chile and Argentina.
